features: Innovative SilentTouch technology for same typing and clicking feel with 90% less noise (1)
Keyboard with 8 convenient shortcuts and full numpad for efficient data entry and easier navigation
Contoured and portable shape with smooth, precise clicking and pointing on most surfaces and SilentTouch technology for quiet clicks, WiFi range (in meters): 10 m
Connect in 3 seconds (2) with a tiny receiver that delivers a strong, reliable 2.4 GHz wireless connection and 10 m range for a clean, clutter-free desk area
Compatible with Windows or Chrome OS and easily connects for plug-and-play simplicity
Spill-proof design (3), durable keys, and sturdy tilt legs with adjustable height
A 36-month keyboard and 18-month mouse battery life—plus on/off switches—means you can go for months without the hassle of changing batteries (4)
body.description: Wireless keyboard and mouse combo that reduces over 90% of noise and maintains the same typing and clicking feel: Innovative SilentTouch technology for the same typing and clicking feel with 90% less noise Keyboard with 8 convenient shortcuts and full numpad for efficient data entry and easier navigation Contoured and portable shape with smooth, precise clicking and pointing on most surfaces and SilentTouch technology for quiet clicks Strong, reliable 2.4 GHz wireless connection with a 10 m range and a tiny USB receiver for a clean, clutter free desk area Compatible with Windows or Chrome OS and easily connects for plug-and-play simplicity Spill-proof design, durable keys and sturdy tilt legs with adjustable height A 36-month keyboard and 18-month mouse battery life—plus on/off switches—to reduce the hassle of changing batteries Gives you one-touch access to play/pause, volume, mute – and even your email. (1) Click and typing noise reduced by over 90% compared to Logitech MK270. Left click and typing dBA level measured by an independent lab at 1 meter. (2) Tested by Logitech with 50 persons in Switzerland (2022). (3) Tested under limited conditions (maximum of 60 ml liquid spillage). Do not immerse keyboard in liquid. (4) Battery life may vary based on user and computing conditions.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: SAME FEEL, LESS NOISE Innovative SilentTouch technology for same typing and clicking feel with 90% less noise.
FULL-SIZE COMFORT Keyboard with 8 convenient shortcuts and full numpad for efficient data entry and easier navigation.
COMFORTABLE & COMPACT MOUSE Contoured and portable shape with smooth, precise clicking and pointing on most surfaces and SilentTouch technology for quiet clicks.

LAG-FREE PLUG AND PLAY WIRELESS Connect in just 3 seconds with one tiny receiver. Strong reliable 2.4 GHz wireless connection with a 10 m range and a tiny USB receiver for a clean, clutter-free desk area. MK295 Silent is compatible with Windows or Chrome OS for plug-and-play simplicity.
BUILT TO LAST Spill-resistant design*, durable keys and sturdy tilt legs with adjustable height. *Maximum of 60 ml liquid spillage. Do not immerse keyboard in liquid.
MONTHS OF BATTERY LIFE A 36-month keyboard and 18-month mouse battery life—plus on/off switches—means you can go for months without the hassle of changing batteries.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is the best keyboard and mouse I've had in quite a while. I needed a quiet keyboard and mouse for my online meetings, and this fits the bill perfectly. Both are VERY quiet, with no keyboarding picked up by others at all while I'm taking notes during meetings. It's also lower auditory stimulus for me as well, as I find the keyboard clicking affects my concentration. The keys have a good feel during typing, just the right amount of resistance but without the clicking noise. I had gotten a thinner model from another brand that used a silicone keyboard cover to help dampen the noise, but it just ended up tearing under use by fingernails, and the mouse was super cheap and flimsy and inaccurate. I should have known to stick with Logitech. Always quality. Bonus, it comes with batteries, and Duracell, not a cheap generic brand. Another great and dependable product. Highly recommend if quiet keyboarding is important.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Pros:Quiet typingReliable performanceMinimal footprintOverall costBuild qualityCons:Slightly less ergonomic compared to larger keyboardsI was looking for a white keyboard with a 10 key that was ergonomic. I had a lower end gaming keyboard that met all of those things. It failed at all the basics. Keying was completely unreliable via the dongle or Bluetooth. Charging was flaky out of the box and I had to use the cable.This keyboard is everything I took for granted. It’s a tad less ergonomic than larger keyboards but I realized quickly the trade off was fine as I had more room on my desk. If you type a lot as a data entry person or programmer, then it might become a problem. For regular users, the ergonomics is fine.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I wanted a wireless keyboard with silent keys for my home office and this works perfectly. I just got a standing desk converter and its nice to not have to worry about the wires when moving from sitting to standing position.The keys are very quiet and so are the buttons on the included mouse. This is my first time with a wireless keyboard and I really like the convenience of it. I like that it has just 1 USB receiver that works for both devices.I also tried this with my xbox Series X just out of curiosity and it works great with that too. I don't have an immediate need for that but its good to know that it is an option.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Extremely quiet! ...but only for a few weeks. Also, NOT a Unifying device
reviews.reviewText: The noise reduction on this keyboard is outstanding. It's almost disorienting how quiet it is, especially given that the tactile experience is not compromised. You still get full, deep key travel with every stroke (which, to me, feels much more satisfying than "slim" laptop-style scissor switch keys). And the membrane switches are not too mushy feeling, despite all the sound reduction techniques.The sad part is that *some* of the noise reduction mechanisms wear out really, really fast. Specifically, what Logitech has done to reduce keycap noise -- the brittle, plasticky sound as you lightly tap or run your fingers over the keys and they rattle in place. There is almost NONE of that noise when this keyboard is brand new, and it's shocking how much of a difference that makes. I didn't realize how obnoxious that noise was until I got this keyboard and it was essentially eliminated....for about 3 weeks. This dampening wears out quickly on keys that are used frequently. The plasticky sound, while still not as loud as a normal keyboard, is beginning to return as I tap or run my fingers over the keycaps. Lesser used keys (number pad, function keys) are still nice and quiet, but over time I'm sure these will also become noisier as I continue to use them.Fortunately, other noise reduction techniques like internal damping and other key switch improvements are still there, so despite the keycaps getting a little bit louder over time, it's still quieter than a standard keyboard.I just wish it would've been silent for a tiny bit longer, as it was quite the experience typing on a full-size, full-travel keyboard that made almost no noise. Then again... it's only thirty bucks.The mouse:It's quieter than a standard mouse, but small and uncomfortable. I ditched it pretty early on in favor of a full-sized Logitech mouse, so can't say much more about it.The dongle:THIS KEYBOARD/MOUSE SET IS NOT UNIFYING. You must use the dongle it came with. Very annoying, especially when you have several other Logitech devices that you previously were able to mix and match. Because I'm using a different mouse than it came with, I now have to occupy TWO USB ports: The dongle it came with (for the keyboard), and a Unifying dongle for the mouse.Why not fewer stars?This keyboard/mouse set is ridiculously affordable. Despite its shortcomings, it's excellent for what little you pay.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quiet, comfortable, affordable.
reviews.reviewText: I use this to game and to work, it works really nicely. The keyboard will be 2-7 feet away from my wife as she sleeps and will not hear it. Not even on calls. So quiet, jelly feeling buttons. I light the shortcuts too. The mouse is a bit small and ironically I picked up a razor mouse that is SUPER loud, but I use my Logi mouse on nights she needs to sleep.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very quiet but still has a good feel when typing
reviews.reviewText: This keyboard was even better than I had expected. There is barely any typing noise, yet I still get that feeling of knowing I'm pressing the right buttons. It's very precise, no fingers slipping off the keys. I cannot say enough good things about how quiet the keyboard is. The only downfall I've found is with the mouse. The mouse is almost TOO responsive/sensitive. This could be a user error on my part, but I've never had a mouse this sensitive. I find myself right clicking on accident very frequently. The slightest hand movement will click the button. It hasn't impeded my work, it is just annoying. I enjoy the keyboard so much that I can overlook the sensitive mouse though.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I only write reviews when a product goes above meeting expectations. The keyboard and mouse are everything I expected and more. When it says silent, it means it. You can barely hear the keyboard and mouse. The size is standard, the keys feel smooth, and have a great feel to them. The color white matched my white monitor perfectly. If you want a silent keyboard, choose this!

Uso diariamente desde julho/2023 e está tranquilíssimo, nem troquei as pilhas. Tanto o teclado quanto o mouse são bem silenciosos. O teclado faz um pouco de barulho (leve), e o mouse é completamente silencioso.Escrevo sem cuidado (rápido, mão pesada) e mesmo assim é difícil me ouvirem digitando algo em uma chamada, por exemplo. Para mim foi um ótimo custo benefício.De vez em quando ele dá delay ou algumas teclas não funcionam por alguns segundos. Pode ser a distância dele até o dongle USB ou algum problema no Wireless, mas apesar de um pouco frustrante não me causou grandes problemas.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very ergonomic, soft touch/sound, good value for money
reviews.reviewText: The keyboard and mouse perform very well. The keyboard is very quiet when typing yet has a "solid" feel to it almost like a mechanical keyboard with the loud clicks. The mouse is of decent quality as well, although not quite as ergonomic as the keyboard (wasn't expecting it to be given the price point of this combo). Overall good value for money and would recommend.

Me gustó, el teclado y el mouse son muy silenciosos, tanto así que cuando lo empecé a usar no estaba seguro si realmente estaba apretando correctamente las teclas. Tal vez el único pero que le pongo es que las teclas sobresalen mucho, son voluminosas como en los teclados antiguos, pero poco a poco te vas acostumbrando.

reviews.reviewTitle: Ergonomic design - perfect for touch typing - highly recommend.
reviews.reviewText: Ergonomic design - perfect for touch typing - highly recommend.

The media could not be loaded. The Logitech Silent Touch Keyboard and Mouse provide a quiet and comfortable typing experience. The low-profile keys on the keyboard feel responsive, and the mouse glides smoothly. The silent click feature is a game-changer, making it ideal for quiet environments. The battery life is impressive, and the overall build quality is solid. Overall, a reliable and user-friendly combo for those who value a noise-free workspace.
